revised_title: Critical Size of Magnetic Particles with High Uniaxial Anisotropy in Applied Fields
tldr: The authors calculate the critical sizes of magnetic particles with high uniaxial anisotropy in the presence of applied fields. They analyze the critical size of an individual grain in a polycrystalline material using two models: one where internal demagnetizing effects arise at non-magnetic gaps at grain boundaries, and another where grains are misoriented from the common easy axis. The study concludes that the latter model is more satisfactory in explaining observed domain structures.
